intro: Neltuma campestris, commonly known as the field neltuma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Neltuma campestris is often found in temperate climates and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
